intro: Scutellaria africana, commonly known as African skullcap, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually blue or violet, arranged in whorls along the stem. The plant is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
